title: Authors and Citation
text: Ricardo Semião. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Semião R (2025). mtsdesc: Plots Tables Describing Multivariate Time Series. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://https://github.com/ricardo-semiao/mtsdesc.
code: @Manual{,   title = {mtsdesc: Plots and Tables for Describing Multivariate Time Series},   author = {Ricardo Semião},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://https://github.com/ricardo-semiao/mtsdesc}, }

what: Plots and Tables for Describing Multivariate Time Series
title: Plots and Tables for Describing Multivariate Time Series
text: mtsdesc R package developed provide mtsdesc provides commonly needed utilities working set time series, .e. multi-panel plots multi-column summary- testing-tables. package also methods work residuals fitter values multivariate time series models. Disclaimer: package early stage life. hasn’t thoroughly tested can present several bugs. don’t recommend using large-scale projects, yet. Please report problems GitHub issue. comments can posted GitHub discussion, sent email . Thank ! Author: Ricardo Semião e Castro (ricardo.semiao@outlook).

title: Plots and Tables for Describing Multivariate Time Series
text: main package functions either plotting ones ggmts_*() summary-table ones tbmts_*(). workflow similar: receive either set time series multivariate time series model. , data extracted. former, series, latter, residuals, fitted, predicted values. done internal generic functions *_setup(). , data processed plot table. output can customized args_* arguments, inject options dimension plot table. result can processed hand function call. now, format time series accepted data.frame-ish object, model, varest vars package. , separation data extraction *_setup() output generation means can provide custom methods *_setup() (eg. *_setup.mts()) rest function work. intent tutorial guide extensions future. Additionally, package originally focused VAR models, plotting functions still called ggmts_*(), yet table functions tbmts_*().

title: Plots and Tables for Describing Multivariate Time Series
text: can install development version mtsdesc GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ricardo-semiao/mtsdesc")

title: Plots and Tables for Describing Multivariate Time Series
text: package nice features, already testing documentation. , ’ve recently changed purpose general mts, adopted new testing conventions. Thus, go major refactor next months. important features plan add future : Start using rlang glue APIs wherever possible, especially “setup” suite. Add tidyselect capabilities. Choose better convention faceting variable names “serie(s)”, “var(s)” “col(s)” namings. Add vars suggests. Add check_installed suggests. better default methods *_setup() functions (assuming dataframes). Rethink test functions list scheme. Add *_setup() documentation function docs, talking existing methods directing engines (“see: ?vars:::predict”). Define convention layers orders. Study importing whole rlang ggplot2. Create table functions tbmts_*() summary testing tables. Add option remove facets graphics single serie. Study plots different versions like _colored. Add tests “helper” “setup” functions. Add tests test function , also documentation roxy. Specify errors expect expect_error calls. Directly test elements ggplots returned functions. Study including warnings arguments args_* aren’t used relevant function. Annotate conventions .md file. tips customize results vignette function docs. Add better examples, add example.qmd vignette. Solve less important lintr notes. Note package: Using styler lintr packages style consistency. Uses testthat vdiffr automate tests. Uses rlang frameworks tidy eval rlang errors.

what: Find build information of a ggplot — get_gg_info
title: Find build information of a ggplot — get_gg_info
text: customize plot made package, adding new layers, useful see data mappings used. function returns list .

title: Find build information of a ggplot — get_gg_info
code: get_gg_info(graph)

title: Find build information of a ggplot — get_gg_info
text: graph ggplot analyze.

title: Find build information of a ggplot — get_gg_info
text: list two entries: main_data: data used ggplot(). layers: layer aesthetic mapping data used (can 'inherited').

title: Find build information of a ggplot — get_gg_info
Plot autocorrelation and similar — ggvar_acf
text: Given dataset VAR model get residuals , ggvar_acf plots auto-correlations (similar) call every series. ggvar_ccf plots cross-correlations (similar) series, grid.

title: Plot autocorrelation and similar — ggvar_acf
code: ggvar_acf(   x,   series = NULL,   lag.max = NULL,   type = "correlation",   graph_type = "segment",   args_type = list(),   args_ribbon = list(linetype = 2, color = "blue", fill = NA),   args_hline = list(yintercept = 0),   args_labs = list(),   args_facet = list(),   ci = 0.95,   ... )  ggvar_ccf(   x,   series = NULL,   lag.max = NULL,   type = "correlation",   graph_type = "segment",   args_type = list(),   args_ribbon = list(linetype = 2, color = "blue", fill = NA),   args_hline = list(yintercept = 0),   args_labs = list(),   args_facet = list(),   facet_type = "ggplot",   ci = 0.95,   ... )

title: Plot autocorrelation and similar — ggvar_acf
text: x dataset (object coercible "data.frame") "varest" object get residuals . series character vector series (variables)  consider. Defaults (NULL). lag.max number lags used calculate ACF, passed acf. type type ACF computed. Can either "correlation", "covariance", "partial". Passed acf. graph_type ggplot geom used create plot: 'segment', geom_segment 'area', geom_area. args_type Arguments passed 'geom' chosen graph_type. args_ribbon, args_hline Additional arguments passed geom_ribbon geom_hline (respectively). See 'Customization' section. args_labs Additional arguments passed labs. empty list, changed default values. args_facet Additional arguments passed faceting engine used. ci confidence level confidence interval. Set FALSE omit. Used geom_ribbon. ... Arguments passed methods, see 'Methods' section. facet_type facet 'engine' used. 'ggplot2' ggplot2::facet_grid, 'ggh4x' ggh4x::facet_grid2.

title: Plot autocorrelation and similar — ggvar_acf
text: ggplot.

title: Plot autocorrelation and similar — ggvar_acf
text: graph can customized 'static' arguments passed layer – using args_* arguments –, , applicable, 'dynamic' aesthetics – using args_aes argument. built, result can customized ggplot, adding overwriting layers ggplot's +. useful understand data mappings coded package, using function get_gg_info. See vignette('customizing-graphs') details.

title: Plot autocorrelation and similar — ggvar_acf
text: data x extracted generic function mtsdesc:::acf_setup mtsdesc:::ccf_setup. class conditions external function pass ... arguments . list currently implemented classes: Class 'varest': passed stats::acf. Class 'default': passed stats::acf.

title: Plot autocorrelation and similar — ggvar_acf
code: ggvar_acf(freeny[-2], args_facet = list(scales = "free_y"))  ggvar_ccf(freeny[-2], args_facet = list(scales = "free_y"))  ggvar_acf(vars::VAR(freeny[-2]), args_facet = list(scales = "free_y"))

title: Plot VAR fitted values — ggvar_fit

text: x "varest" object get fitted values . series character vector series (variables)  consider. Defaults (NULL). index vector labels x-axis, normally dates. Must length equal x$obs. title: Plot VAR predictions — ggvar_predict
text: Gets predictions via stats::predict plots . Can also plot known values past.

title: Plot VAR predictions — ggvar_predict
code: ggvar_predict(   x,   series = NULL,   index_ahead,   index_behind = NULL,   ci = 0.95,   args_aes = list(),   args_line = list(),   args_ribbon = list(fill = NA, linetype = 2, color = "blue"),   args_labs = list(),   args_facet = list(),   ... )

title: Plot VAR predictions — ggvar_predict
text: x "varest" object get predictions . series character vector series (variables)  consider. Defaults (NULL). index_ahead vector labels x-axis, normally dates. Applied predicted portion graph. length define prediction horizon. index_behind vector labels x-axis, normally dates. Applied original portion graph. length define 'past' horizon. Leave NULL plot predicted values. ci confidence level confidence interval. Set FALSE omit. Used predict. args_aes Defines aesthetics differentiate data. named list aesthetics names (*) – arguments passed ggplot2::scale_*_manual. See 'Customization' section. args_line, args_ribbon Additional arguments passed geom_line geom_ribbon (respectively). See 'Customization' section. args_labs Additional arguments passed labs. empty list, changed default values. args_facet Additional arguments passed faceting engine used. ... Arguments passed methods, see 'Methods' section.

"AIC", "HQ", "SC", "FPE". trans transformation apply criteria result (vector). Can function, "none" (default), "index" create index numbers. args_aes Defines aesthetics differentiate data. named list aesthetics names (*) – arguments passed ggplot2::scale_*_manual. See 'Customization' section. args_line Additional arguments passed geom_line (respectively). what: mtsdesc: Plots and Tables for Describing Multivariate Time Series — mtsdesc-package
title: mtsdesc: Plots and Tables for Describing Multivariate Time Series — mtsdesc-package
text: Describe multivariate time series tables ggplots. mtsdesc provides commonly needed utilities working set time series, .e. multi-panel plots multi-column summary- testing-tables. package also methods work residuals fitter values multivariate time series models.

title: mtsdesc: Plots and Tables for Describing Multivariate Time Series — mtsdesc-package
text: Maintainer: Ricardo Semião ricardo.semiao@outlook.com

title: mtsdesc (development version)
text: 25/07/2024 - Major refactoring codebase. 11/13/2023 - Remade code styling styler lintr, created setup helpers (“setup_ggvar_…”). 11/10/2023 - Added testthat (& vdiffr) basic tests. 11/06/2023 - Initial update github (development version, yet tested CRAN suitable).
